t: Psalm 78
God’s Guidance of His People in Spite of Their Unfaithfulness.
A Maskil of Asaph.
Listen,*pn O my people, to my instruction; Incline*ln your ears to the words of my mouth.
I*ln will open my mouth in a parable; I*ln will utter dark sayings of old,
Which*ln we have heard and known, And*ln our fathers have told us.
We*ln will not conceal them from their children, But*ln tell to the generation to come the praises of the Lord,*s And*ln His strength and His wondrous works that He has done.
For*ln He established a testimony in Jacob And*ln appointed a law in Israel, Which*ln He commanded our fathers That*ln they should teach them to their children,
That*ln the generation to come might know, even*i the children yet*i to be born, That*iln they may arise and tell them*i to their children,
That*ln they should put their confidence in God And*ln not forget the works of God, But*ln keep His commandments,
And*ln not be like their fathers, A*ln stubborn and rebellious generation, A*ln generation that did not prepare its heart And*ln whose spirit was not faithful to God.
The*ln sons of Ephraim were archers equipped with bows, Yet*iln they turned back in the day of battle.
They*ln did not keep the covenant of God And*ln refused to walk in His law;
They*ln forgot His deeds And*ln His miracles that He had shown them.
He*ln wrought wonders before their fathers In*ln the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.
He*ln divided the sea and caused them to pass through, And*ln He made the waters stand up like a heap.
Then*ln He led them with the cloud by day And*ln all the night with a light of fire.
He*ln split the rocks in the wilderness And*ln gave them*i abundant drink like the ocean depths.
He*ln brought forth streams also from the rock And*ln caused waters to run down like rivers.
Yet*ln they still continued to sin against Him, To*ln rebel against the Most High in the desert.
And*ln in their heart they put God to the test By*ln asking food according to their desire.
Then*ln they spoke against God; They*ln said, “Can God prepare a table in the wilderness?
Behold,*ln He struck the rock so that waters gushed out, And*ln streams were overflowing; Can*ln He give bread also? Will*ln He provide meat for His people?”
Therefore*ln the Lord*s heard and was full of wrath; And*ln a fire was kindled against Jacob And*ln anger also mounted against Israel,
Because*ln they did not believe in God And*ln did not trust in His salvation.
Yet*ln He commanded the clouds above And*ln opened the doors of heaven;
He*ln rained down manna upon them to eat And*ln gave them food from heaven.
Man*ln did eat the bread of angels; He*ln sent them food in abundance.
He*ln caused the east wind to blow in the heavens And*ln by His power He directed the south wind.
When*ln He rained meat upon them like the dust, Even*ln winged fowl like the sand of the seas,
Then*ln He let them*i fall in the midst of their camp, Round*ln about their dwellings.
So*ln they ate and were well filled, And*ln their desire He gave to them.
Before*ln they had satisfied their desire, While*ln their food was in their mouths,
The*ln anger of God rose against them And*ln killed some of their stoutest ones, And*ln subdued the choice men of Israel.
In*ln spite of all this they still sinned And*ln did not believe in His wonderful works.
So*ln He brought their days to an end in futility And*ln their years in sudden terror.
When*ln He killed them, then they sought Him, And*ln returned and searched diligently for God;
And*ln they remembered that God was their rock, And*ln the Most High God their Redeemer.
But*ln they deceived Him with their mouth And*ln lied to Him with their tongue.
For*ln their heart was not steadfast toward Him, Nor*ln were they faithful in His covenant.
But*ln He, being compassionate, forgave their*i iniquity and did not destroy them;*i And*ln often He restrained His anger And*ln did not arouse all His wrath.
Thus*ln He remembered that they were but flesh, A*ln wind that passes and does not return.
How*ln often they rebelled against Him in the wilderness And*ln grieved Him in the desert!
Again*ln and again they tempted God, And*ln pained the Holy One of Israel.
They*ln did not remember His power, The*ln day when He redeemed them from the adversary,
When*ln He performed His signs in Egypt And*ln His marvels in the field of Zoan,
And*ln turned their rivers to blood, And*ln their streams, they could not drink.
He*ln sent among them swarms of flies which devoured them, And*ln frogs which destroyed them.
He*ln gave also their crops to the grasshopper And*ln the product of their labor to the locust.
He*ln destroyed their vines with hailstones And*ln their sycamore trees with frost.
He*ln gave over their cattle also to the hailstones And*ln their herds to bolts of lightning.
He*ln sent upon them His burning anger, Fury*ln and indignation and trouble, A*ln band of destroying angels.
He*ln leveled a path for His anger; He*ln did not spare their soul from death, But*ln gave over their life to the plague,
And*ln smote all the firstborn in Egypt, The*ln first issue*i of their virility in the tents of Ham.
But*ln He led forth His own people like sheep And*ln guided them in the wilderness like a flock;
He*ln led them safely, so that they did not fear; But*ln the sea engulfed their enemies.
So*ln He brought them to His holy land, To*ln this hill country which His right hand had gained.
He*ln also drove out the nations before them And*ln apportioned them for an inheritance by measurement, And*ln made the tribes of Israel dwell in their tents.
Yet*ln they tempted and rebelled against the Most High God And*ln did not keep His testimonies,
But*ln turned back and acted treacherously like their fathers; They*ln turned aside like a treacherous bow.
For*ln they provoked Him with their high places And*ln aroused His jealousy with their graven images.
When*ln God heard, He was filled with wrath And*ln greatly abhorred Israel;
So*ln that He abandoned the dwelling place at Shiloh, The*ln tent which He had pitched among men,
And*ln gave up His strength to captivity And*ln His glory into the hand of the adversary.
He*ln also delivered His people to the sword, And*ln was filled with wrath at His inheritance.
Fire*ln devoured His young men, And*ln His virgins had no wedding songs.
His*ln priests fell by the sword, And*ln His widows could not weep.
Then*ln the Lord awoke as if*i from*i sleep, Like*ln a warrior overcome by wine.
He*ln drove His adversaries backward; He*ln put on them an everlasting reproach.
He*ln also rejected the tent of Joseph, And*ln did not choose the tribe of Ephraim,
But*ln chose the tribe of Judah, Mount*ln Zion which He loved.
And*ln He built His sanctuary like the heights, Like*ln the earth which He has founded forever.
He*ln also chose David His servant And*ln took him from the sheepfolds;
From*ln the care of the ewes with suckling lambs He brought him To*ln shepherd Jacob His people, And*ln Israel His inheritance.
So*ln he shepherded them according to the integrity of his heart, And*ln guided them with his skillful hands.
